1: It was a hot summer day in the dry forest.
2: Little Ant had no water for many days.
3: "I need a drop of water, even if it falls from a leaf," cried Little Ant.
4: But even the dew had dried up.
5:
"If I do not have water, I will die," cried Little Ant. 
"I must go to the river I heard about."
6: "The river is full and strong. It will sweep you away," warned a wise squirrel.
7:
But Little Ant was extremely thirsty. 
"I will die if I don’t drink some water."
So, he went to look for the river.
9: He walked past tufts of grass and over dry branches.
10:
He walked until he heard water splashing. 
It was the river!
He could hear waves.
11: Little Ant took a long sip of cool water.
12: He was so happy he did not see a wave coming.
13:
Little Ant tried to grab some grass floating past him. 
But he was swept away by the water.
14: "Help me someone. Help me please!" he called.
15: "Quick, climb on," said White Dove, holding a branch in her beak.
17:
"I will stay here until I can thank the dove," decided Little Ant. 
"I will wait until she comes back to drink."
18:
One day as he waited, two boys came to the river. 
They had their slingshots.
19:
"There is a big white dove that comes here to drink," said one boy. 
"We will have it for supper tonight."
21:
"I cannot let the boys kill White Dove," thought Little Ant. 
"But I am so tiny, what can I do?"
22: Just then White Dove flew down from the tree to drink.
25:
He jumped onto one boy’s foot. 
Little Ant bit that boy as hard as he could.
27: White Dove was startled and flew away to safety.
28: That was how Little Ant thanked White Dove for saving him.
